title: Does a power bank lose power the minute I unplug it? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, yes and no. The power is really energy stored in a internal battery. Once removed from a charger the battery is unloaded. However, an unloaded battery has a small amount of what they call self discharge. It may be a few percent per month. The amount varies with age and temperature and individual cells. So yes, it loses energy. (which is power over time) But a very small amount. After a month or so it may easily have some 90% of its energy still.

A rechargeable battery is an enclosed chemical box where always a chemical reaction is going on , direction of that reaction is decided by applied current If current applied forward reaction to charge battery, In alkaline batteries there's no reverse reaction for charging , it has only discharging reaction Since in rechargeable batteries both reactions are present , they loos charge in a short time, as impurities in chemical cause self discharge with in the cells, compared to alkaline batteries Once you unplug internal self discharge , (which is always there even if you are charging) bigins in one week time or more depending on quality of the product it fully discharge An alkaline battery retain charge till shelf life
